p: where RFC s(max) is the relative frequency of citation over the maximum, i.e., it is obtained by dividing FC s by the maximum value in all the species of the literature sources [RFC s(max) = FC s/max (FC)], and RNU s(max) is the relative number of use-categories over the maximum, obtained dividing the number of uses of the species by the maximum value in all the species of the literature sources [RN s(max) = NU s/max (NU)].
